Package domain

Class CommandProcessor

java.lang.Object
domain.CommandProcessor
public class CommandProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
This class is specially made for the creation of the block structure in programArea. This means dragging, connecting, disconnecting, making and deleting blocks. If a block is disconnected, dragged and again connected, this counts as one execution step. It has a stack of the commands, the cursor and number of the undone commands.
Version:
4.0
Author:
Andreas Awouters Thomas Van Erum Dirk Vanbeveren Geert Wesemael

  • Method Details

    • undo

      public void undo()
      This function undoes the next command to undo. An undone Command can always be redone, except when a new change has been made when this command has been undone.

    • redo

      public void redo()
      This function redoes the most recent undone command.

    • executed

      void executed​(Command command)
      When a block has been dragged, a new draggingCommand has been made. This function makes sure that command is added to the undostack so this command can be undone in the future.
      Parameters:
      command - The new command that HAS BEEN executed.

    • dragCommand

      public void dragCommand​(game_world.api.Vector oldPos, game_world.api.Vector newPos, PresentationBlock<?> block, Command preCommand, Command postCommand)
      This function is used to make a new draggingCommand and store it in the undoStack.
      Parameters:
      oldPos - The previous position of the mouse.
      newPos - The current position of the mouse.
      block - The block that is bein dragged
      preCommand - The command that has been executed before the block has been dragged. This can be making a block or disconnecting.
      postCommand - The command that has been executed after the block is released. This can be deleting or connecting a block.
